m5uisMq9QDIheStBnmMz8Q.text: This visit was not typical nor representative of what I would typically expect or receive from Barringtons.  It wasnt bad but it wasnt great.  I had asked my partner to take me to celebrate my 40th birthday dinner at Barringtons.   Its been a few years since I have dined there.  The service was OK....the server was somewhat attentive .... and her timing was fine....but the vibe wasnt what I had remembered.   She did fine.  She left us alone for the most part.  I had the pan seared scallops.  My dish was cooked to perfection.  As I was nearing the end of my dish....I noticed my partner was really struggling to eat his.    I couldn't figure it out.  He had the Shrimp and Grits.  He said to me "Im having trouble getting this down".   I asked why.....and he said the flavor tasted good but the shrimp was a little tough.    I asked to try one of his shrimp.  Much to my dismay....his shrimp were more rubbery than a piece of tire.   I chewed, and I Chewed, And I CHEWED.    .....then I chewed some more.  I told him to send it back....but he insisted I let it go.  He didn't want to make a spectacle of the situation.   In order not to cause any uncomfortable moments, I said nothing.  While the food is on the pricey side....I hated for the shrimp to go to waste.   I ate 3 (because I can pretty much eat anything)....while he finished the rest of the grits.  All in all, our expereince was not bad or horrible .....but for a fine dining experience.....we were just a little let down.    I am not sure I would return.   Things just dont seem like I remember them.

fdT9ofi2-MoF03pmhtTlHg.text: Forget eating at the big crowded uptown restaurant. Barrington's offers fine dining with a beautiful intimate setting.  Amazing flavors!!! Restaurant had great intimate setting. I can't even tell you how wonderful it was to have an exceptional meal served in a restaurant where you don't have to deal with the noise of alot of people cramped into a large restaurant or having to lean forward to speak to you dinner companion just to have a conversation!    The staff was very attentive and knowledgeable. The foie gras melts in your mouth and tuna tar tar was exceptional. Please don't get me started with the seared scallops or the duck breast served with pickled carrots and veggies.  The flavors and culinary experience wouldn't fit on this comment space. Guess you'll just have to try it.  This is definitely THE BEST RESTAURANT IN TOWN!!!! AMAZING!!!!!  By the way.... Barrington's was considered a top ten best in the nation a few years ago and you'll find out why when you come to eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrington's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Barrington's - Charlotte, NC, United States. This made my mouth dance. The apple butter was a great addition and the pickled root veggies were a perfect balance of sweet and sour.
Photo of Barrington's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seared scallops cooked to PERFECTION!!! Creamy grits and beef rib ragout was phenom!

m4mSFxNFH4Z7OTR_44t45A.text: This was my first time at Barrington's and we'll definitely be back.  We had a reservation and were seated promptly upon arrival.  Great location for a nice quiet evening, date night or other.  We started with the cauliflower soup and it was hot and delicious.  We decided to split a small portion of the rigatoni pasta and wish we would of gotten the full size as it was amazing.  Four our entree's my daughter had the braised short ribs and I had the pork chop.  Both were beyond expectations and first time I've seen a pork chop sliced and served against the bone; great idea and presentation was top notch.  We decided to give the trio of cream brulee a whirl for our dessert and we should of skipped that.  A trio of Peanut Butter, white chocolate and banana.  The banana tasted like smashed bananas and the peanut butter and white chocolate were just OK.  The service was great, food was hot and overall a great evening for us foodies!

iV4q0H73wZl8ND2DQq3z5Q.text: Came on Saturday night I can't even begin to tell you how once again our dinner was amazing!! If you end up here soon get the Monkfish with Lobster Tempura it was soooooo good!!! The Gnocchi was amazing along with our soups!! I Love this place the food is Amazing and so is the Service!!!

B2eYmnV--2yvNO4HZP0T0A.text: When my good friend notified me that Bruce Moffet had recently been recognized as one of the best chefs in Charlotte on the cover of Creative Loafing this month, we just had to eat here.  So we made reservations for 7:00 PM yesterday evening for dinner.  The place was completely full on a Wednesday night if that tells you anything.  You see my good friend and I worked for Bruce in his early restaurant days at Pizza Villa over 20 years ago and were shocked to hear that he bought the place 18 years ago and was recognized as having some of the best food Charlotte has to offer!!  Where does the time go?  Anyway - I had the Pecan crusted pork tenderloin and my friend had the Braised Beef Short Ribs.  He also had the Arugula salad with bleu cheese and we each had the French Onion soup.  All of it was outrageously delicious and we will definitely be returning for a future special occasion.  You will not be disappointed should you choose to visit Barrington's!

30ojGBAA0-6kaKiddOq1vw.text: Simply the best restaurant in Southpark, can say enough great things about the food here. Service is amazing too!

auOfYb89ssORySI3fxi0MQ.text: Best restaurant in Charlotte.  Great place for an intimate dinner, like an anniversary or an escape from the kids!

_iTzFw5gBOvC7ffOr6DvfA.text: we were so disappointed to not have eaten at your restaurant, .we have always been your biggest fans, spreading the word to who ever would listen. we had a reservation 6 days ago. we were seated at the 1/2 a table(2top) in the window. we were sandwiched between to parties and requested any other table or even the bar. manager never came back to tell us that all were reserved for others. what about our reservation? this table is not suitable for anyone., why don't you try it sometime? needless to say, we did not stay.

Ih_h75T0NotnuDSaf_fy0A.text: I chose this restaurant based off its Yelp reviews.  Wow, they were not kidding about this place being small!  I think my living room is bigger.  In total, there were only 9 groups in the entire place and they were at capacity and we were less than a foot away from the group dining next to us (who were rather uppity and kept looking at us as if we were intruding on their dining experience by sitting near them) so I understand why they require reservations.   I would say the average age of the people dining was around 50-60+.  I felt a little young being there, but I wasn't treated that way by the staff, it was more from the patrons, who I think were a little full of themselves (most had that 'I'm SO important' vibe going on.)    I did not get the pretentious air at all from the staff that I was expecting while I was at the restaurant, but I did while making the reservation (don't contact them online or leave a message, they don't call you back and the people on the phone aren't very pleasant -they were even snippy when we called to confirm the reservation).    I had the shrimp with the cole slaw and corn bread for an appetizer.  While it sounds like an odd mix, I was actually sad when I finished it.  I don't even like cole slaw and I was tempted to start licking my plate just to get the last parts that I couldn't pick up with my fork.  For my main course I had the chicken with spinach and mashed potatoes.  Yum. Yum. Yum.  Everything had so much flavor and tasted fresh.  All of us at the table ordered something different and every serving was met with mmm's to near moaning so I think my entire party was pleased with their meal. The food is excellent and the portions are large (the mussels appetizer could be a meal) so you aren't left feeling hungry and bitter and when the $$$ check shows up.  We never felt rushed and the evening was very relaxing and pleasant.  We even got to meet the chef/owner Bruce, who is very friendly, which was an added plus.

Bme5RbZoiTfEG8MWpfEAXg.text: We really wanted to love Barrington's - truly we did - but we were disappointed on a recent visit...the negatives far outweighed the positives.  positives:  charming setting, excellent service...friendly, attentive, and gracious without being pretentious, quality ingredients, and a few high spots:  wonderful fresh corn soup with lobster, beautifully cooked and delicate veal tenderloin, good bread with a nice quality olive oil and balsamic dip. negatives:  Dishes were almost universally oversalted (particularly the breading on the crispy quail, but also the gnocchi with its ragu of veal and porcini);  the sesame crust on our foie gras was burned, our waitress told us that the kitchen's kale was a "little" spicy --- holy heat!  the kale was hot enough to kill the delicate flavor of that  beautifully cooked sliced veal tenderloin;  the veal and porcini sauce was extremely heavy, the veal pieces tasted like overcooked stew meat, and far too much Parmesan was grated on top.  Plus, the restaurant's noise level makes conversation almost impossible.    Wish we could give a higher rating.  P.S.  A recent visit to their sister restaurant (Good Food on Montford) gave us a uniformly superior experience with no significant negatives.  We hope that our dinner at Barrington's was just an anomaly, but, as the saying goes, you are only as good as your last croissant.

oIWRnQ6RISsSdVdaMcM_RQ.text: Despite the wonderful and top notch food, I doubt we will be back.  The service was ok, when I asked for my mixed green salad without turnips the waitress challenged me that I should get them.  I politely re-requested that my salad be served the way I requested.  We were rushed to order entrees along with our bottle of  wine.  Seemed like they were in a rush to turn over our table which they were success at since we were out in an hour.  Now we choose to go elsewhere for dessert since the noise level in the restaurant was so high I couldn't hear my husband talk.  I can't fault the chef, the food was wonderful but when I go out for a quality dinner, I don't want to be rushed and I would like to hear the conversation of those I am with.  Lots of other options in charlotte.

o6OU6NzO1sN0YwBM82mQHA.text: We had a family dinner 3/12/2010... we ate a bit late at 8:30 pm but the place was still busy...the homemade hot bread was great...3 of the 4 of us had an artichoke soup with black truffle cream and a little maine lobster...just wonderful and served very hot for all...a well done arugula salad with fresh apples and goat cheese completed our first course...we all had something different for dinner...I had a pot pie with saddle and loin of rabbit and it was amazingly well done, hot, flavorful and rich...my wife had parmasean gnocchi with veal....my younger daughter had tagliatelle with mushrooms, cream  and english peas and my older daughter had beef bourguignon with Pomme Anna, bacon lardon and winter vegetables and braise reduction....all were excellent....service was very good and friendly...we brought wine in ('99 Clos de Tart) and paid the $20 corkage without hesitation...stemware was fair/adequate but not great...the only detractor from the whole experience was the fairly loud environment Overall this was a great experience ... total bill (with 2 glasses of Latour Chardonnay) was a little over $200

d4cDYKUYT5USZigGHmYe9Q.text: This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants back home. I miss the restaurant's delicious dishes, not to mention the warm intimacy it offers.

AANkI0qSNotjVT8jlDdm_Q.text: This is the best restauraunt I have eaten at in Charlotte. The food is really world class. The small 20 table dining room really makes it feel very warm and personable. Chef Bruce Moffett really pays attention to detail when preparing his dishes. Their signature starter in my oppinion are the mussels, very simple, and have always been perfectly cooked. You can't go wrong wrong with any of the main dishes, I especially like the roasted Halibut, and this is a restauraunt worth ordering the chicken dish(pan seared with creamy potatoes, sounds plain but is very delicious). The Veal and Porcini Gnocchi are also worth a try. You can not beat Barrington's for any special occasion.
